summary: The Extending Anti-Terrorism Protections Act of 2025 aims to grant the Secretary of Homeland Security the authority to temporarily extend the duration of protections provided under the SAFETY Act (Support Anti-Terrorism by Fostering Effective Technologies Act of 2002) for qualified anti-terrorism technologies. This extension applies through fiscal year 2029, contingent on timely and complete renewal applications. The bill's purpose is to allow time for the official renewal process and does not preclude a final decision on the renewal application.
